page.title: 19St.George's Hill
page.content: The name St. George's Hill is 1600 years old. 2 million years ago St.George's Hill was a paeolithic camp 14 acres long. Weybridge was a big marsh so the camp was the only dry area. Did you know the Grand Old Duke of York is true? He marched up and down this hill with his soldiers for training. In 1852 the last duel ever was held on St. George's Hill. Geographically speaking ,St. George's Hill now covers about 4 square kilometres in area, with woodland covering a lot of the space. All the houses have very big gardens of at least an acre. Many very famous people live here. There is here an underground reservoir with 3 days supply of water,a big golf course and a tennis club.
